intro: Cracca oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves that are often broad and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky environments. Cracca oblongifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
